h1: How Many Calories in a Pint of Blueberries?
assumptions: Fresh, whole blueberries; 1 pint ≈ 300 g; no added sugar or toppings.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by ripeness, variety, and growing conditions. Check labels for packaged products.

quick_answer.text: A pint of fresh blueberries contains about 171 kcal and provides 7.2 g of fiber.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Dried blueberries (equivalent to 1 pint fresh by volume, ≈100 g)

faqs.q: How many calories in a pint of blueberries?
faqs.a: Approximately 171 kcal for 1 pint (300 g) of fresh blueberries.
Yes, with only 57 kcal per 100 g, making a pint a low-calorie, nutrient-dense snack.

faqs.q: How much sugar is in a pint of blueberries?
faqs.a: About 30 g of natural sugars, mostly from the fruit itself.

faqs.q: What's the fiber content in a pint of blueberries?
faqs.a: Around 7.2 g of dietary fiber, supporting digestion and heart health.

faqs.q: Do frozen blueberries have the same calories as fresh?
faqs.a: Very similar; frozen ones have about 54 kcal per 100 g, so a pint is roughly 162 kcal.
